author: ab2157
title: BED BUGS
text:
The reason I didn't write a review earlier is because the company who paid for this 2 day stay tried to get a refund and was refused, and so as I lay here at 3am scratching and seething at the thought of that stay, I thought now may be appropriate .
So on the 1st day I took a 3 hour 'nap' to be woken by bedbugs running over my face.
I was kind and discreet enough to Premier Inn to not go to reception shouting about it ( since reception was full), and a guy inspected the room and then asked " do I want a room change?" - I'd say so, and if you've got a change of my skin whilst you're at it that would be perfect.
I then had to ask if I could have my clothes laundered that had been on the bed, and then had to further ask for some compensation - the clothes laundering was met by some head scratching ( prob from their hotel being infested ) as they " don't provide that service", and the company refunded 1 of the 2 nights stay. Since it was my partner's company that paid, I thought I'd let Premier Inn take it up further with them themselves.
At no point did a manager come to the room and apologise and at no point any lovely things offered to ease my wrecked mind that bed bugs may be nesting in my suitcase ( and knickers).
So off we go home to then worry for the next month about harboring hitchhiking bedbugs in the luggage- (since it can take a few months to know in your own bed if you have), and then continue to obsess and google about this in the small hours, leading to purchase 100% alcohol spray to then spray everything down subsequently rendering our abode 100% flammable.
So, if the manager reads this, it would be nice if he/ she could at least offer the other nights stay refund? - but I doubt it since he/she couldn't even be bothered coming to the 3rd floor to apologise.
I also have a video of these critters and I'm being nice not posting it to see if Premier Inn will play nice back and refund the night.
